Overall, I still think we, as a community, need to hold project teams to a much higher bar than we currently are. We are funding vapor with the hope it turns into something solid; we should instead be funding something solid that can turn into something massive.
- High mint prices are an investment in the company. This can be good if it‚Äôs a solid team with clear allocation of funds, or a money grab if they don‚Äôt have the necessary experience.

- NFTs have flipped the investment model; we are investing before a product is actually built. This is EXTREMELY speculative; recognize this and be comfortable with the risk, or find ways to derisk by waiting until the team delivers or demanding more of founders.

- Buying pre-reveal is increasingly risky in this hype driven world. I believe this is the case as teams are setting bigger and bigger expectations to attract investment without understanding the difficulty involved.
- 3D art is risky. Think about the massive teams at AAA game studios and cgi shops; these aren‚Äôt small contractor teams.

- If the roadmap or team is suspect, be comfortable paying the price for what you are getting today, not tomorrow. I‚Äôm happy to pay for today's art if I love it, even if it may not evolve into something in a few months.
- Roadmaps need to be ruthlessly prioritized. Many projects seem to promise work that simply won‚Äôt move the needle, while deprioritizing things that may actually matter.
‚Ä¶For these ambitious projects, having the art side alone simply isn‚Äôt enough. I am going to stay away from imbalanced teams, and from teams with little history to show.

These reveal fails are teaching us a few things:
- We are over-estimating teams‚Äô ability to execute. Do better diligence. As someone who ships products to hundreds of millions of users, I work with a team balanced mostly with engineers, followed by product and design.

PSA: any analysis that says ‚Äúonly X listings until Y floor!‚Äù is fundamentally flawed. 

Sellers/buyers near floor are often flippers, which means many listings will be bought and relisted multiple times before you hit your Y target. Floor can be much thicker than you realize.
